importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the timeline of events surrounding Doug Martin's death, which occurred earlier in the week, and highlights the public reaction and ongoing investigations as of this date.
The date reflects when the news was reported to the public, emphasizing the recent nature of the incident and the timing of official statements from law enforcement and the NFL organization.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline spans from the break-in incident on Saturday (early October 2025) to the public announcement and subsequent statements released on Monday (October 20, 2025), illustrating the sequence of events and the emergency response.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back and All-Pro with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died during a police arrest related to a break-in in Oakland.
Martin was involved in a brief struggle with police while being taken into custody, after fleeing his home due to mental health challenges.
His former agent, Brian Murphy, confirmed that Martin had long struggled with mental health issues that significantly impacted his life and that he was seeking help before the incident.
The Oakland Police Department and city officials expressed condolences, and the death is under investigation by multiple agencies including police, the city commission, and the district attorney.
Martin's career included being a first-round draft pick in 2012, a Pro Bowl selection, and recognition as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers history.
The incident has sparked broader conversations about mental health, police interactions, and accountability in community-based enforcement.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died during a police arrest in Oakland, California, following a break-in investigation. He was reportedly struggling with severe mental health challenges, which led to him fleeing his home and entering a neighbor’s home. Police reported a brief struggle during his detention, and he later died in hospital. The Oakland Police Department, city officials, and Martin’s former agent Brian Murphy have all issued statements expressing condolences and offering context about his mental health struggles. The incident has prompted investigations by multiple agencies, and the cause of death has not been released. Martin, a 2012 first-round draft pick, had a standout career with the Buccaneers, earning Pro Bowl honors and being recognized among the franchise’s top 50 players.
title: Former NFL Star Doug Martin Dies in Oakland After Police Custody
